posts.post_content:
For a fun little combo, run her with the incredibly creepy looking [Phyrexian Unlife](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Unlife). That should allow you to not lose for a while. The only problem is that you would want blue to protect your feeble 2/2 and enchantment.
  
   
(If this combo doesn't work as I think it does, please give me a RTFC comment so I don't waste peoples time)

posts.post_content: If you're against an Infect deck, this card is pure gold (she said as though it were not glaringly obvious). Sure, she needs protection from various types of removal, destruction, and direct damage, but so do most good permanents. Of course, unless you're running a deck that also takes advantage of her abilities when you're *not* raging against the tyranny of Phyrexia, you're going to want to leave her in your sideboard.

posts.post_content:
@Falgren  
  
Her ability that removes infect from opponents' creatures is a continuous one, so even if someone uses tainted strike to give their creature infect, it will immediately be lost again once state based actions are checked (right after the spell resolves). There is no mentioning of an EtB trigger.
posts.html:
@Falgren

Her ability that removes infect from opponents' creatures is a continuous one, so even if someone uses tainted strike to give their creature infect, it will immediately be lost again once state based actions are checked (right after the spell resolves). There is no mentioning of an EtB trigger.

posts.post_content:
How does this interact with [Everlasting Torment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Everlasting Torment)? Is her second ability be considered damage reduction?  
  
Edit: Based on the rulings for [Tatterkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tatterkite), Melira will work great with ET:  
  
Tatterkite's ability: *Tatterkite can't have counters placed on it.*  
  
Ruling: *If Tatterkite is dealt damage by a creature with wither, that damage has no effect. **It's not prevented**; it just doesn't do anything. Abilities that trigger on damage being dealt will still trigger.*  
  
So based on that, with ET and Melira out, damage to creatures wouldn't be prevented, it just would have no effect.
posts.html:
How does this interact with Everlasting Torment? Is her second ability be considered damage reduction?

Edit: Based on the rulings for Tatterkite, Melira will work great with ET:

Tatterkite's ability: Tatterkite can't have counters placed on it.

Ruling: If Tatterkite is dealt damage by a creature with wither, that damage has no effect. It's not prevented; it just doesn't do anything. Abilities that trigger on damage being dealt will still trigger.

So based on that, with ET and Melira out, damage to creatures wouldn't be prevented, it just would have no effect.

posts.post_content:
@Flashismyfriend; I believe the word your looking for is Balanced, not *Weaker*  
  
Why, why, WHY are people asking if she removes counters? Her wording is probably the clearest, simplist wording I've seen on a card with more than five words, in the past 10+ sets. Stop trying to read into it; it does exactly what it says, and nothing else.   
  
That being said, there's a lot of confusion over what other cards say, and how they interact with her. Any card or effect that would -place- a -1/-1 counter doesn't work.  
Cards like Devoted Druid are now useless, because you simply just can't pay the cost. Treat it the same way you would if the card said "Discard one card: Untap devoted druid", and there was a card out that said "cards cannot be discarded". You simply cannot pay the cost, so the effect never even sees the stack.  
Contrarywise, if a card would place a counter as part of an effect - ANY EFFECT, the whole ability resolves 100% as normal, just without seeing the -1/-1 counter... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
@Flashismyfriend; I believe the word your looking for is Balanced, not Weaker

Why, why, WHY are people asking if she removes counters? Her wording is probably the clearest, simplist wording I've seen on a card with more than five words, in the past 10+ sets. Stop trying to read into it; it does exactly what it says, and nothing else.

That being said, there's a lot of confusion over what other cards say, and how they interact with her. Any card or effect that would -place- a -1/-1 counter doesn't work.
Cards like Devoted Druid are now useless, because you simply just can't pay the cost. Treat it the same way you would if the card said "Discard one card: Untap devoted druid", and there was a card out that said "cards cannot be discarded". You simply cannot pay the cost, so the effect never even sees the stack.
Contrarywise, if a card would place a counter as part of an effect - ANY EFFECT, the whole ability resolves 100% as normal, just without seeing the -1/-1 counter... (see all)
